title: Random Variable
text:
Integration

\(\int x^3+2x\)
\(\int_2^3 x^2+x\)
Relationship between integration (I) and differentiation(D).


Answer


\(f(x) \to I \to D \to f(x)\)
Test with \(f(x) = x^2\)

title: Random Variable
section: Number of Heads in Coin Toss
text:
Number of Heads in Coin Toss
A coin is tossed twice
S = {HH, HT, TH, TT}

X = number of heads in the tosses
What are the possible values of x?
x = 0, 1, 2

Fill the probabilities



x
0
1
2




p(x)







N:B: X is variable & x is value

title: Random Variable
text:
PDF vs PMF Curve


PDF

Continuous


PMF

Discrete

title: Random Variable
text:
Integration and Area
  Source: hyperphysics 

Area = Integration = Probability (if [0,1])
\(Area = height \times width = \int f(x) \times dx\)

title: Random Variable
text:
PDF and PMF Conditions


PDF
  Source: upgrad.com 

\(0 \le f(x) \le 1\)
\(\displaystyle \int_{-\infty}^\infty f(x)dx = 1\)



PMF











\(0 \le P(X=x) \le 1\)
\(\sum P(x_i) = 1\)
Thus the sum of all possible outcomes is zero

title: Random Variable
text:
PDF and PMF Properties


Probability Density Function (continuous)

\(\displaystyle \int_{{\, - \infty }}^{{\,\infty }}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}} = 1\)
\(P\left( {a \le X \le b} \right) = \int_{{\,a}}^{{\,b}}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}}\)
\(P(X=x)=0\) (theoretically, why?)



Probability Mass Function (discrete)

\(\displaystyle \sum_{{\, - \infty }}^{{\,\infty }}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}} = 1\)
\(P_x(X) = P(X=x)\)

title: Random Variable
text:
PMF Problem 01
\(\displaystyle P(x) = \frac{x+1}{k}; x= 1,2,3,4\)

k = ?
\(P(X \ge2)\)
\(P(X \le 3)\)
\(P(2 < X \le 5\)

title: Random Variable
text:
PMF Problem 02
Given, \(P(x) = \frac{2x+k}{56}; x = -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3\)
Discrete or Continuous?

k = ?
Find probability of each value of x
Find \(P(-2 \le x \le 2)\)

title: Random Variable
text:
PMF problem from coin
An unbiased coin is tossed four times and the number of times the heads are obtained is denoted by x. Determine the probability mass function.

\(S = \{HHHH, HHHT, \cdots\}\)
\(x = 0, 1, 2, 3, 4\)
\(P(X = 2) = \frac{4C_2}{2^4}\)
\(P(x) = \frac{4C_X}{2^4}\)

title: Random Variable
text:
PDF Problem 01
\(\displaystyle f(x) = kx(x-1); 1\le x \le 5\)

Find k
\(P(X>1)\)
\(P(X \le 3)\)
\(P(2 \le x < 4)\)

title: Random Variable
text:
cdf definition
\(F_X(x) = P(X\le x)\)


Discrete
\[F(x) = \sum_{X\le x} P(x)\]


Continuous 

\[F_{X}(x) = \int_{-\infty}^x f_X(t)dt\]
Find cdf for \(f(x) = 2x; 0\le x \le 1\)
\(\int \to x^2\)


Answer


\[\begin{eqnarray}
F(x) =
\begin{cases}
x^2/2,  & 0\le x \le 1 \\
0, & \text{otherwise}
\end{cases}
\end{eqnarray}\]

title: Random Variable
text:
cdf properties

\(P(a\le x \le b) = F(b)-F(a)\)for \(a\lt b\); what if \(a \lt x \lt b?\)
For continuous x, \(f(x) = \frac{d}{dx}[F(x)]\)
\(F(-\infty) =0 , F(+\infty) = 1\)

Marginal: \(P(Pass) = P(x_1)=P(x_1,y_1)+P(x_1,y_2)+P(x_1,y_3)\)

title: Random Variable
text:
Marginal Probability
Consider the previous table
Joint probability: \(P(x_i, y_j); i = 1,2, \cdots m; j = 1,2, \cdots n\)
Marginal probability \(\to P(x_i) \leftarrow P(x_i, y_j)\)

For x: \(\displaystyle P(x_i) = \sum_{j=1}^n P(x_i, y_j); i = 1,2, \cdots m\)
For y: \(\displaystyle P(y_i) = \sum_{i=1}^m P(x_i, y_j); j = 1,2, \cdots n\)
What about continuous x?

title: Random Variable
text:
Marginal Probability Properties

\(P(x_i) \ge 0\) and \(P(y_i) \ge 0\)
\[\sum_{i=1}^m P(x_i)=\sum_{j=1}^n P(y_j)=1\]

Summing marginal probabilities will give 1.

title: Random Variable
text:
Joint-Marginal Example
\(P(x,y) = \frac{x+y}{9}; x=0,1,2; y = 0, 1\)

Find marginal probabilities
Check properties (sum)


\(P(x) = \frac{2x+1}{9}\)

title: Random Variable
text:
Conditional Probability Function
Like Bayes Theorem
\(P(X_i|y_j) = \frac{P(x_i,y_j)}{P(y_j)}; P(y_j) \gt 0\)
Properties

\(\sum_{j=1}^m P(x_i|y_j)=\sum_{i=1}^m P(y_j|x_i)=1\)

title: Random Variable
text:
Conditional Probability Example
\(P(x,y) = \frac{x+y}{9}; x=0,1,2; y = 0, 1\)
Find \(P(X|Y)\) and \(P(Y|X)\)
Find for continuous X as well.

If a man is randomly selected, what is the probability that his daily income is 400 BDT?

\(AM = \frac{61500}{125}=492\)
In expectation, \(rf\) is the weight (Total weight = 1)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Expectation from Mean
\(\displaystyle \bar X=\frac{\Sigma x_if_i}{\Sigma f_i}\)

\(= \frac{x_1f_1+x_2f_2+\cdots+x_3f_3}{N}\) (letting \(\Sigma f_i=N\))
\(= x_1\frac{f_1}{N}+x_2\frac{f_2}{N}+\cdots +x_2\frac{f_n}{N}\)
\(= x_1p_1+x_2p_2+\cdots+x_np_n\)
\(= \sum x_i\cdot p(x_i)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Expectation
Probabilities are weights
\[\begin{eqnarray}
E(X) &=& x_1 \times P(x_1) + x_2 \times P(x_2)+ \cdots +x_n \times P(x_n)      \nonumber \\
&=& \displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^n x_i \times P(x_i) \nonumber \\
\end{eqnarray}\]

For continuous X


\(\displaystyle E(X) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(x)dx\)



\(E(X^2) = \sum x^2 \times p(x)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Expectation Example



\(X\)
0
1
2




\(P(x)\)
\(\frac 1 4\)
\(\frac 1 2\)
\(\frac 1 4\)



Find

\(E(X)\)
\(E(X^2)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Properties of Expectation
Aslo refer to the properties of AM (\(E(X)=\bar X\))

Expectation of a constant, \(E(c)=c\)
\(E(aX)=aE(X)\)
\(E(X-a) = E(X) - E(a)\)
\(E(aX+b) = aE(X)+b\)
\(E(X+Y) = E(X)+E(Y)\)
\(E(XY) = E(X) E(Y)\) (if independent, relate with probability)
\(E(X^2)\ge \{E(X)\}^2\)
\(E\left(\frac 1 X \right) \ge \frac 1 {E(X)}\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Variance
Recall this (click)
We knew, \(\sigma^2 = \bar {X^2} - (\bar X)^2=\) Mean of square - square of mean

\(V(X)=E(X^2)-\{E(X)\}^2\)
Original Formula: \(V(X) = E\{x-E(X)\}^2\) (Match)
Expand and prove these are equal

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Variance Properties

\(V(c)=0\) ponder, why?
\(V(X+a)=V(X)\)
\(V(aX+c) = a^2V(X)\) (depends only on scale, recall)
\(V(X+Y) = V(X)+V(Y)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Covariance
\(Cov(X,Y) = \frac{\Sigma (x-\bar x)(y-\bar x)}{n}\)
Write in terms of \(E(X)\)

\(Cov(X,Y) = E [\{x-E(X)\}\{y-E(Y)\}]\) (Expand)
\(E(XY)-E(X)E(Y)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Prove E(X) Properties
Go back to see the properties

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
E(a)
\(E(a) = \sum a \cdot p(x_i)\)

\(=a \cdot \sum p(x_i)\)
\(=a \times 1 = a\)
Others can be proven similarly

If sum over \(x_i\), we get only 1 column at a time
If sum over \(y_i\), we get only 1 row at a time
SO to get grand total, we must use \(\sum \sum (x_i+y_j)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
E(X+Y) & E(XY)

\(E(X+Y)\)

\(= \displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^m \sum_{j=1}^n (x_i+y_j)P(x_i,y_j)\)
\(=\displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^m \sum_{j=1}^n \{x_iP(x_i,y_j)+y_jP(x_i,y_j)\}\)
\(=\displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^m \sum_{j=1}^n x_iP(x_i,y_j)+\sum_{i=1}^m \sum_{j=1}^n y_jP(x_i,y_j)\)
\(=\displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^m x_i\sum_{j=1}^n P(x_i,y_j)+\sum_{j=1}^n x_i\sum_{i=1}^m P(x_i,y_j)\)
\(=\displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^m x_i P(x_i) + \sum_{j=1}^n y_j P(y_j)\)
\(=E(X)+E(Y)\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
AM & HM
\(E(\frac 1 X) \ge \frac 1 {E(X)}\)

\(AM \ge HM\)
\(HM =\) opposite of mean of opposite \(\to \frac{1}{\frac{\sum \frac 1 {x_i}}{n}} = \frac 1 {E(\frac 1 x)}\)
\(E(X) \ge \frac{1}{E(\frac 1 x)}\)
If \(0.5 \gt \frac 1 3 \to 3 \gt  \frac 1 {0.5}\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Variance of constant (a)
\(V(X) = E\{X-E(X)\}^2\)

\(V(a) = E\{a-E(a)\}^2\)
\(E(a-a)^2\)
\(E(0)=0\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
V(aX+b)
\(V(X) = E\{X-E(X)\}^2\)
\(V(aX+b)=\)

\(E\{(aX+b)-E(aX+b)\}^2\)
\(E\{aX+b-aE(X)-b\}^2\)
\(E\{aX-aE(X)\}^2\)
\(a^2E\{X-E(X)\}^2\)
\(a^2V(X)\)
Does variance depend on origin and scale?
\(V(X+Y)=?\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Cov(X,Y) Properties
For independent X, Y

\(\to E(XY) = E(X)E(Y)\)
\(Cov(X,Y) = E(XY) - E(X)E(Y) = 0\)
Correlation, \(r = \frac{Cov(X,Y)}{\sigma_x \sigma_y}=0\)

title: Mathematical Expectation
text:
Example 02: \(P(x) = \frac 1 n\)

title: Elementary Statistics
text:
Frequency Distribution
Three things required

\(Range, R = X_H - X_L\)
No.Â of classes (k) &
Class Interval (CI)
Let k or CI & find the other
\(CI  = \frac{Range}{\text{Number of classes (k)}}\)
\(\text{Number of classes, k}= \frac{Range}{\text{CI}}\)

Variable types


Discrete

Isolated/specific values
Not just Integers!

Continuous

Any value between any two value possible
Example: Height, radius

title: Elementary Statistics
text:
Arithmetic Mean

\(\bar{X} = \displaystyle \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n} X_i}{n}\)
Grouped data: \(\displaystyle \bar{X} = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i x_i}{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i} = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i x_i}{N}\)

title: Elementary Statistics

\(\displaystyle \bar{X} = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i x_i}{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i} = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{k} f_i x_i}{N}\)

title: Elementary Statistics
text:
Weighted Mean
Weighetd mean: \(\displaystyle \bar{X}_w =  \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n} w_i X_i}{\sum_{i=1}^{n} w_i}\)
